description: Reconfiguration of existing single storey garage to provide habitable space
decision_conditions: Development  shall  be  carried  out  in  accordance  with  the  materials  specified  on  the approved plans and on the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.
The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

No building or use hereby permitted shall be occupied or the use commenced until the cycle parking provision shown on the approved plans has been completed, and thereafter, be kept free of obstruction and available for the parking of cycles only.Reason: To ensure the provision of adequate cycling facilities in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

No building or use hereby permitted shall be occupied or the use commenced until the refuse store, and area/facilities allocated for storing of recyclable materials, as shown on approved plan DRG NO: PL_00_110 Rev.03 and PL_00_111 Rev.01  has been completed in accordance with the approved plans. The developer and/or their successors in title shall take all reasonable steps to ensure that all refuse and recyclable materials associated with the development shall either be stored within this dedicated store/area as shown on the approved plans, or internally within the building(s) that form part of the application site, and that no refuse or recycling material shall be stored or placed for collection on the public highway or pavement, except on the day of collection.Reason: To ensure the provision of refuse facilities to the satisfaction of the Council in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.
Please complete Certificate B and return the original to this office.

The development approved by this planning permission will be liable to pay the Mayor of London's Community Infrastructure Levy (MCIL) and the Royal Borough of Kingston CIL (KCIL).  Payment will be due once the owner/developer serves a development Commencement Notice on the Council, and a payment Demand Notice has been received by the owner.  Failure to submit a Commencement Notice will incur a surcharge of 20% of the chargeable amount or Â£2,500, whichever is the lower amount.   When you have discharged all pre-commencement conditions the Council will issue a Liability Notice to the owner setting out the MCIL calculation.  Accompanying the Liability Notice will be a  blank Commencement Notice and if necessary a blank Assumption of Liability form, both of which need to be completed and returned to the Council prior to development commencing.  A failure to do so will incur a surcharge.  Should you have any questions in respect of the contents of this letter or the CIL more generally, please contact the Council's Contact Centre by email mcil@rbk.kingston.gov.uk <mailto:mcil@rbk.kingston.gov.uk> or phone 0208 547 5002.Should you wish to seek 'self build' exemption from CIL please refer to the Council's website Ref: https://www.kingston.gov.uk/info/200380/community_infrastructure_levy

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise due to COVID19 lockdown. Photos provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:The works are largely acceptable with the exception of T.4. The photos is not clear enough to demonstrate species but it is clear enough to demonstrate the girth of the trunk indicating it's age. The photo is also clear enough to demonstrate that the canopy is still healthy with good growth at the time the photo was taken. As the tree is clearly covered by the TPO and no reason or evidence has been provided for it's removal, this element should be refused.Recommendation:Refuse & grant lesser works as follows:T.2 Malus - Reduce crown to previous pruning points.T.3 Pittosporum - Reduce by 50% and clear from property by 2m (Exempt).T.5 Maple - Remove dead branch over road.T.6 Elm - Fell (dead).

1. Grade and section size of floor joists suitable for the imposed loading and spans at 600c/c (A1)2. Mains operated, battery backed up, interlinked smoke detection to hall and landing due to the increased threat to the ground floor and means of escape (B1)
